title: Why the Chicago Teachers Union Always Gets What It Wants
sub_head: It can strike and ignore children because Illinois lawmakers give it extraordinary power.
body:
Chicago
For the fifth time in 10 years, the Chicago Teachers Union shut students out of the classroom this month. Covid mitigation policy was the reported reason for the recent four-day walkout in the nation’s third-largest school system, but a look at the CTU’s decadeslong history of strikes and walkouts shows the pandemic was an excuse for the union’s latest power play.
